data.title: Our Fallen Heroes
data.text:
LODD: 12/04/1964

On December 4, 1964, David A. Poplis succumbed to an embolism, resulting from a fracture sustained when he fell from a moving ambulance.

Related Links

Evening Star Obituary

Washington Post Obituary

LODD: 04/19/1968

On April 19, 1968, Captain Richard B. Thomas was with several other members responding to a brush fire on Chandlee Mill Road. The vehicle overturned killing him.

Related Links

Washington Post News Story

Washington Post Obituary

LODD: 04/01/1971

On April 1, 1971, career Sergeant Eldridge Pier suffered a fatal stroke while fighting a brush fire on Chandlee Mill Road in Brookville, MD.

LODD: 9/21/2023

On September 21, 2023, Master Firefighter Michael A. McTighe, Jr. succumbed to his injuries after being involved in a personal injury collision while driving home from a membership meeting.

Related Links

Obituary
